Refreshing VSS Data

StarTeam queries the VSS database as to the current status of files before displaying them in a project view window. Only the Windows client can refresh VSS data. When you press F6 for a foreign refresh, the application calls a synchronous routine. It uses the refresh feature instead of the event hook mechanism in VSS because using the event hook mechanism can make the StarTeam repository out of sync with VSS.

Calling the synchronous routine updates the current folder in StarTeam. Each existing file is checked for new revisions and lock status. StarTeam requires each new revision of a file to have a check-in date later than that of the previous revision. Because this restriction does not exist in VSS, StarTeam changes the check-in dates on revisions when necessary.

New files and folders are recognized by StarTeam, and files that were deleted from VSS are also deleted from the application. However, folders that were deleted from VSS are not deleted in StarTeam.

Using rollback views, the historical data for a deleted item can be displayed in StarTeam. However, because the deleted item was stored in VSS, rather than a StarTeam repository, revisions of the deleted item cannot be recovered. Pressing F6 will not refresh the screen in a rollback view, because these views are treated as read-only.

It is recommended that you enable the All Descendants button before pressing F6 so that the refresh recurses through all the known child folders.

In some circumstances, pressing F6 produces an error message stating that StarTeam is unable to refresh an item and that the user should delete the item and press F6 again. Doing this produces a current view that correctly represents the foreign archives. However, in a rollback view, the deleted item now appears twice.

Important: If several users simultaneously do foreign refreshes, application performance may become slower.
